p: The application of encapsulated essential oils also supports their controlled and sustained release, which enhances their bioavailability and efficacy against multidrug-resistant pathogens ( Prakash et al., 2018). Owing to its greater stability, the formulation with 1:4 rate (oil:surfactant) was selected for studying the antibacterial activity against S. aureus. This is a common opportunistic microorganism that is found in skin abrasions and open wounds and the most commonly isolated contagious organism from mastitis and dermatitis in cattle, sheep, goats, pigs, and horses ( Peton and Le Loir, 2014; Boss et al., 2011).
